title: 107_s1042
content: The Act titled "Filipino Veterans' Benefits Improvements Act of 2001" establishes the rate of payment for certain benefits for new Philippine Scouts residing in the United States. Section 107 of title 38, United States Code is amended to redesignate provisions and adjust the rate of payment for benefits. Subsection (c) is designated as subsection (d), and subsection (b) is modified to include exceptions in payments. The amendments made by subsection (b) of H.R. 5482 of the 106th Congress adjust payment provisions and take effect upon enactment, applying to benefits paid after that date. SEC. 3 amends the rate of payment for dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses of certain Filipino veterans under title 38, United States Code. The effective date is upon enactment and applies to benefits paid after that date. SEC. 4 addresses the eligibility of certain Filipino veterans for disability pension. The eligibility and rate of payment for dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses of certain Filipino veterans under title 38, United States Code, are amended. The amendments include changes to subsections (a) and (b) regarding eligibility criteria and payment rates. The eligibility and rate of payment for dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses of certain Filipino veterans under title 38, United States Code, are amended. The amendments include changes to subsections (a) and (b) regarding eligibility criteria and payment rates. Specifically, subsection (b) is further amended to include a new subsection (e) outlining payment rates for individuals residing in the Republic of the Philippines. The amendments made by this section will increase benefits for surviving spouses of certain Filipino veterans residing in the Republic of the Philippines to $100 per month, effective upon enactment of the Act. SEC. 5 amends section 1734 of title 38, providing health care for Filipino veterans in the US. SEC. 6 addresses outpatient health care for veterans in the Philippines. Section 1735 of title 38, United States Code, provides outpatient care and services for World War II veterans residing in the Philippines. The Secretary shall furnish care for service-connected and nonservice-connected disabilities at the Manila VA Outpatient Clinic, with a limit of $500,000 expenditure per fiscal year. The Secretary shall provide outpatient care and services for World War II veterans in the Philippines at the Manila VA Outpatient Clinic, with a yearly expenditure limit of $500,000. Outpatient care and services for World War II veterans in the Philippines will be provided at the Manila VA Outpatient Clinic with a yearly expenditure limit of $500,000. The amendments made by this section will take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.
